intro: Isotrema punjabense, commonly known as the Punjab stellaria, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Stellariaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped white flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, often found in rocky soils and along dry stream beds. It has a low-growing habit with slender stems and small, opposite leaves. Isotrema punjabense is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
